properties.name: aggregateRating
properties.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

properties.name: audience
properties.description: The intended audience of the item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

properties.name: brand
properties.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the product.

properties.name: depth
properties.description: The depth of the item.

properties.name: gtin13
properties.description: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

properties.name: gtin14
properties.description: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

properties.name: gtin8
properties.description: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the item.

properties.name: isAccessoryOrSparePartFor
properties.description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

properties.name: isConsumableFor
properties.description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

properties.name: isRelatedTo
properties.description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

properties.name: isSimilarTo
properties.description: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

properties.name: itemCondition
properties.description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

properties.name: logo
properties.description: An associated logo.

properties.name: manufacturer
properties.description: The manufacturer of the product.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

properties.name: mpn
properties.description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

properties.name: offers
properties.description: An offer to provide this itemâ€”for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, or give away tickets to an event.

properties.name: productID
properties.description: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: .

properties.name: releaseDate
properties.description: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.

properties.name: review
properties.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: The weight of the product or person.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the item.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: description
Thing.description: A short description of the item.

Thing.name: image
Thing.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
